intro: Hibbertia florida subsp. florida, commonly known as the golden wattle, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its bright yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and birds. The plant has narrow, lance-shaped leaves and is typically found in sandy or rocky soils. It belongs to the family Dilleniaceae and is known for its ornamental value in gardens. Hibbertia florida subsp. florida is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
